DataElement.preferredName: Progressive Disease After First Therapy Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval in days from the date of the patient's initial pathologic diagnosis to the date of tumor progression after initial treament.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PD Post First Therapy Subtract Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity._Post; occuring after._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._The act of removing a part from the whole._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: PD Post First Therapeutic Procedure Subtraction Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:Post; occuring after.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of removing a part from the whole.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg 12/2010 sw

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Initial D
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Initial Diagnosis to Date of New Tumor Event

ReferenceDocuments.name: TCGA Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Initial Pathologic Diagnosis to the Date of Tumor Progression After Initial Treatment

ReferenceDocuments.name: HCMI Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of days from date of initial pathologic diagnosis of the primary tumor to date of progression
